Territory Management.details: Three-month rolling GP tiers set < $425K or ≥ $425K with SKU-level commission floors of 3% and 6% respectively; if GP% falls below the floor, the rate equals actual margin (2025_GDG_Medical_Inside Sales Consultant_Standard Commission Plan-FINAL_v3.pdf p.002).

New Bill-To Eligibility.details: New bill-to premium adds 2% MELPS GP for 12 fiscal months but excludes IDN segments and requires account-level coding outside IDN (p.003).

Lab & Strategic Premiums.details: Large capital/lab equipment pays +5% MELPS GP, other lab +2%, high-dollar customers (+$875 prior-quarter GP) +2%, GEMS suppliers +1%, and HS Preferred brands +2%, with the latter three requiring ≥17% gross margin (p.003–004).

Performance-to-Plan True-Up.details: Premium ranges from 0.25% to 4.0%; months 1–2 of each quarter cap at the 0.50% tier, with a month-3 quarterly recompute and true-up vs. total standard business MELPS GP (p.005).

Federal & Fixed-Rate Governance.details: Federal business is ineligible for performance premiums and capped at 15% per SKU; fixed-rate entities cap commissions at the designated rate for that entity (p.007).

Shared Lab Credit.details: Salesforce entry is required; shared lab deals split 15%/10% depending on service owner, with no other premiums or spiffs outside the Lease Points policy (p.007–008).

Freight, AR & Inventory Deductions.details: Freight waivers/credits reduce commissions; AR chargebacks deduct 0.25%–2.75% for invoices aged 60–150 days, obsolete inventory clawback is 20% of loss (p.009).

Sample Use & Adjustments.details: Sample accounts can only support demos/trials; personal use is deducted from commissions, and commissions remain unearned until adjustments and manageable expenses post (p.010).

SPIF Governance.details: Weekly recoverable draws generally ≤70% of the ISC’s three-month annualized MELPS commission history; draws/spiffs can be reduced or netted if output lags (p.011).

Leave, Modifications & Bridge.details: Sales credit stops seven days into a leave; company may change/cancel the plan, employment stays at-will, and bridge payments can offset plan transitions (p.012).

Eligibility.details: RSMs must be employed at time of payout; bonus prorated for mid-year hires; plan may be updated as business needs change.

KPI Caps.details: Quarterly MELPS KPI payouts capped at 100%; annual true-up can reach 400%; flu goal also capped at 400%.

Windfall/Large Deals.details: No windfall or large-deal clause referenced; gap noted.

Eligibility.details: SGEs must be employed at payout; bonus prorated for mid-year entries; plan may be updated as business needs change.

KPI Caps.details: Quarterly payouts capped at 100%; annual super achiever payout up to 400%.

Windfall/Large Deals.details: No windfall/large-deal clause documented; gap noted.

Dispute SLA.details: Sales & Business Leadership with HR interpret plan terms; participants have 60 days from the end of each commission cycle to dispute calculations in writing (2025_TriMed East Area Regional Manager (Foot and Ankle).pdf p.002).

Leave of Absence.details: Only PTO/FTO/holiday absences maintain sales credit; other leaves retain credit for shipments up to 14 days after leave start, after which commissions stop and accounts may be reassigned (p.003).

Termination/Final Pay.details: Sales shipped through the separation date are payable, but the annual growth bonus (paid within 45 days after year-end) requires the participant to be employed on the payout date (p.003).

Sales Crediting.details: Sales/GP credit is not earned until revenue is recognized under GAAP/ASC 606; management may exclude products from the plan and must withhold applicable taxes (p.004).

Side Letter Prohibition.details: Participants acknowledge they cannot issue side letters, extend terms, or make unapproved commitments; violations can trigger discipline (p.005).

Quarterly True-Up.details: If the annual growth quota is met, the 3% growth bonus is recomputed on all annual growth dollars and reduced by paid quarterly bonuses to create a catch-up payout (p.002).

Dispute SLA.details: Sales leadership and HR resolve disputes; participants have 60 days from the close of each commission cycle to submit issues in writing (2025_TriMed West Area Regional Manager (Foot and Ankle).pdf p.002).

Leave of Absence.details: Only PTO/FTO/holidays retain credit; other leaves receive credit for shipments up to 14 days after leave start before commissions stop and accounts may be reassigned (p.003).

Termination/Final Pay.details: Sales shipped through separation are payable, but the annual bonus (paid within 45 days post-year-end) requires active employment on the payout date (p.003).

Sales Crediting.details: Sales/GP credit is not earned until revenue is recognized under GAAP/ASC 606, and management can exclude products or adjust withholding as needed (p.004).

Side Letter Prohibition.details: Participants attest they will not issue side letters, extend terms, or make unapproved inducements; violations can lead to discipline (p.005).

Quarterly True-Up.details: When the annual growth quota is met, the 3% rate is applied to all annual growth dollars and reduced by quarterly bonuses already paid to generate a catch-up payout (p.002).

Monthly Eligibility.details: OSRs must work or take approved PTO for at least three full weeks of the month to qualify for monthly bonuses; quarterly eligibility requires six weeks and annual eligibility requires five months (2025_HSPG_Hayes_Outside Sales Representative (OSR, USAHAY002).pdf p.002, p.004).

Dispute SLA.details: Questions or disputes must be submitted in writing within 30 days of the award; after that, all awards are final (p.006).

Windfall/Large Deals.details: Company reserves the right to designate windfalls (e.g., competitor recall, large acquisition) and decide if any bonus will be paid (p.005).

Leave of Absence.details: Only PTO/FTO/holiday-coded absences accrue sales credit; unpaid leave stops credit once FTO usage is exhausted, per the FMLA example (p.005).

Sales Crediting.details: Sales count only when shipped/invoiced and revenue recognized; representatives must not issue side letters, extend terms, or make unapproved commitments (p.005, p.008).

SPIF Governance.details: Participant must be employed on payout date; resignations before payment forfeit awards and unpaid spiffs/blitzes, transfers receive prorated bonuses through transfer date (p.006).

Quarterly Catch-Up.details: If quarterly GP hits 100%+, Hayes pays 100% of any unearned monthly bonuses from that quarter via a true-up (p.003).

Capital Commission Tiers.details: EdgePro/Laser systems pay 28.5% GP up to the annual target (15 systems in Addendum A) and 50% GP for sales beyond the target; commission only triggers after signed agreement, intent-to-pay, shipment, and revenue recognition (2025_HSPG_Endodontics_Endodontics Specialty Sales Consultant (J305039 ESSC).pdf p.002, p.004, p.006).

Quarterly Consumable Bonus.details: GP growth payouts range from $1,250 at 50% attainment to $15,000 at 110% and increase by $1,000 for every 10% above 140%; targets reset each quarter (p.003).

Leave Eligibility.details: Must work at least three full weeks in a month to earn commissions and six weeks in a quarter to earn consumable bonuses; company may reassign accounts during leave (p.004).

Dispute SLA.details: ESSCs have 60 days from the end of a bonus cycle to dispute payments in writing; after that, calculations are final (p.004).

Active Employment Requirement.details: Participants must be actively employed in an eligible role on the payment date to receive commissions/bonuses unless local law dictates otherwise (p.004).

Sales Crediting.details: Bonuses are not deemed earned until GAAP/ASC 606 revenue recognition is met; representatives sign a side-letter prohibition acknowledging they cannot extend terms or make unapproved commitments (p.005).

Expense Reimbursement.details: Mileage reimbursed via Motus, other business expenses via Concur with IRS Publication 463-compliant documentation; ESSCs can request additional reimbursement if needed (p.002).

Monthly Bonus Eligibility.details: Monthly GP bonuses require at least three full weeks worked in the month; payouts use the 80%–100% scale with net adjustments for returns (2025_HSPG_Brasseler Dental_Associate District Sales Manager (ADSM, J304784)_V3 (FINAL).pdf p.003).

Quarterly Bonus Eligibility.details: Quarterly bonuses require six full weeks worked in the quarter and follow the 80%–110%+ tiered table; annual true-up restores missed quarterly payouts once yearly GP target is met (p.005–006).

Annual Overachievement Criteria.details: Annual bonus pays 20% of GP above quota, plus an extra 2.5% if GEM sensor and restorative material goals are met with ≥45% GP margin; must work five months and be active on fiscal year end (p.007).

Dispute SLA.details: Participants have 60 days from the end of the month/bonus cycle to dispute calculations; after that, payouts are final (p.008).

Payment Timing.details: ADSMs must be in a bonus-eligible role on payout dates; payments occur on the second pay cycle following the month/quarter/year and are based on shipped/invoiced GP net of returns (p.003, p.007–008).

Sales Crediting.details: Bonuses are not earned until GAAP/ASC 606 revenue recognition occurs, and ADSMs sign a side-letter prohibition covering unapproved concessions (p.008–009).

Expense Reimbursement.details: Mileage reimbursed via Motus and all other reasonable business expenses through Concur with IRS Publication 463-compliant documentation; ADSMs may request additional reimbursement (p.002).

Monthly Bonus Eligibility.details: Monthly GP bonuses require at least three full weeks worked and follow the 80%–100% payout table; payments occur on the second payroll after month-end and are net of returns (2025_HSPG_Brasseler Dental_District Sales Manager I (DSM I J304269)- A.pdf p.003).

Quarterly Bonus Eligibility.details: Quarterly payouts require six weeks worked in the quarter, use the 80%–110%+ scale, and annual catch-up restores missed quarters once yearly GP hits 100% (p.005–006).

Annual Overachievement Criteria.details: Pays 20% of GP above quota, plus an extra 2.5% when GEM sensor and Retail/GPO restorative quotas (≥45% GP margin) are achieved; participant must work five months and be active on fiscal year-end (p.007).

Dispute SLA.details: DSM Is have 60 days from the end of each bonus cycle to dispute calculations in writing; after that awards are final (p.008).

Active Employment Requirement.details: Must be in a bonus-eligible role on payout dates; quarterly/annual payments are based on shipped/invoiced sales net of returns (p.003, p.008).

Sales Crediting.details: Bonuses are not earned until GAAP/ASC 606 revenue recognition occurs; DocuSign acknowledgement prohibits side letters and authorizes GP adjustments (p.009).

Expense Reimbursement.details: Mileage reimbursed through Motus, all other reasonable expenses via Concur with IRS Publication 463-compliant documentation; DSMs may request additional reimbursement (p.002).

Monthly Bonus Eligibility.details: Monthly GP bonuses (22.5% of mix) require at least three full weeks worked and pay per the 80%–100% scale; payouts run on the second payroll following month-end and are net of returns (2025_HSPG_Brasseler Dental_District Sales Manager II (DSM II J304270) A.pdf p.003).

Quarterly Bonus Eligibility.details: Quarterly GP bonuses (22.5% mix) require six weeks worked in the quarter; annual catch-up restores missed quarters once annual GP reaches 100% (p.005–006).

Annual Overachievement Criteria.details: Pays 20% of GP above quota plus an extra 2.5% when GEM sensor and Retail/GPO restorative goals are met with ≥45% GP margin; must work five months and be active on fiscal year-end (p.007).

Dispute SLA.details: 60-day written dispute window following each bonus cycle; after that, calculations are final (p.008).

Active Employment Requirement.details: Participants must be in a bonus-eligible role on payout dates; incentives are based on shipped/invoiced GP net of returns (p.003, p.008).

Sales Crediting.details: Bonuses are not earned until GAAP/ASC 606 revenue recognition occurs, and DSM IIs sign a side-letter prohibition that requires approved pricing/terms (p.009).

Expense Reimbursement.details: Mileage via Motus and other reasonable expenses via Concur with IRS Publication 463-compliant documentation; DSM IIs may request additional reimbursement (p.002).

Sales Crediting.details: Commissions are only earned after draws, overdraws, freight deductions, AR chargebacks, sample account adjustments, and obsolete inventory charges are applied; unpaid invoices deducted 0.25–2.75% up to 150 days.

Draws/Guarantees.details: Bi-weekly recoverable draw; overdraws netted against advances; AR chargeback schedule 60–150 days.

Leave of Absence.details: Commission credit extends 7 days from leave start; company may reassign accounts.

Termination/Final Pay.details: Only sales invoiced through separation earn commissions; overdraws repaid; unpaid SPIFs forfeited.

Exceptions/Disputes.details: Plan text does not specify an SLA or dispute process; gap noted.

Windfall/Large Deals.details: No windfall or large-deal clause present; gap noted.

Monthly Bonus Eligibility.details: Monthly bonuses (25% of mix) require at least three full weeks worked; payouts follow the 80%–100% scale and pay on the second payroll after month-end, net of returns (2025_HSPG_Brasseler Dental_Sr District Sales Manager (SDSM, J304271).pdf p.003).

Quarterly Bonus Eligibility.details: Quarterly bonuses (25% mix) require six weeks worked in the quarter; annual catch-up restores missed quarters once annual GP hits 100% (p.005–006).

Annual Overachievement Criteria.details: Pays 20% of GP above quota plus an extra 2.5% when GEM sensor and Retail/GPO restorative goals are achieved with ≥45% GP margin; must work five months and be active at fiscal year-end (p.007).

Dispute SLA.details: SDSMs have 60 days from the end of the bonus cycle to dispute calculations in writing; decisions are final afterward (p.008).

Active Employment Requirement.details: Must be in a bonus-eligible role on payout dates; incentives are based on shipped/invoiced GP net of returns (p.003, p.008).

Sales Crediting.details: Bonuses are not earned until GAAP/ASC 606 revenue recognition occurs, and SDSMs sign a side-letter prohibition authorizing GP adjustments (p.009).

Expense Reimbursement.details: Mileage reimbursed via Motus and other reasonable expenses via Concur with IRS Publication 463-compliant documentation; SDSMs may request additional reimbursement (p.002).

Monthly Bonus Eligibility.details: Monthly GP bonuses (25% of mix) require the IAM to work at least three full weeks in the month; payouts follow the 80%–100% scale and pay on the second payroll after month-end (2025_HSPG_Brasseler Dental_Inside Account Manager_(J303330 IAM) Q2_FINAL.pdf p.002).

Quarterly Bonus Eligibility.details: Quarterly bonuses (15% mix) use the accelerator table (40% at 90% attainment up to 150% at ≥120%) and require six full weeks worked in the quarter (p.004).

Annual Bonus Accelerator.details: Annual GP bonuses (15% mix) pay 0% below 100% attainment and scale to 400% at ≥130%; paid the second payroll after year-end (p.004).

Eligibility Thresholds.details: IAMs must work at least three weeks per month, six weeks per quarter, and five months per year to earn the respective bonuses (p.005).

Dispute SLA.details: Participants have 60 days from the end of each bonus cycle to dispute calculations in writing; decisions after that are final (p.006).

Active Employment Requirement.details: IAMs must be in a bonus-eligible role on payout dates; incentives are calculated on shipped/invoiced GP net of returns (p.002, p.005).

Quarterly GP Achievement Table.details: Merchandise GP (70%) and Equipment GP (30%) follow Achievement Chart A: ≤89% pays 0%, 90% pays 50%, 92% pays 60%, 95% pays 75%, 99% pays 95%, ≥100% pays 100% (2025_GDG_Dental_Regional General Manager (RGM) Bonus Plan.pdf p.001).

Quarterly True-Up.details: If annual combined GP reaches 100%+, any prior quarter paid under 100% is restored to 100% via a Q1 payout the following year (p.001).

Annual Super Bonus.details: Annual GP above target pays an uncapped 5% bonus; achieving ≥100% in both merchandise and equipment for all four quarters triggers an additional 0.05% on all GP back to dollar one (p.003).

Dispute SLA.details: Participants have 30 days after the end of a fiscal quarter or year to dispute bonus calculations; submissions go through the Area Executive Director/VP (p.003).

Termination/Final Pay.details: Must be employed on payout date; transfers receive prorated bonuses through their last day, and credits issued after termination adjust payouts; unpaid spiffs are forfeited unless required by law (p.003).

Motus Reimbursement.details: Mileage reimbursed via Motus at IRS rates; all miles must be tracked within Motus (p.003).

Quarterly GP Allocation.details: Merchandise GP (70%) and Equipment GP (30%) follow Achievement Chart A (≤89% = 0%, 90% = 50%, 92% = 60%, 95% = 75%, 99% = 95%, ≥100% = 100%) identical to the West plan (2025_GDG_Dental_Regional General Manager Bonus Plan.pdf p.001).

Annual True-Up & Super Bonus.details: Annual performance ≥100% restores any under-100% quarters to 100% and adds a 5% growth bonus plus 0.05% on all GP if every quarter for both categories meets/exceeds 100% (p.003).

Termination/Final Pay.details: 30-day dispute window, active-employment requirement on payout dates, prorated bonuses on transfers, and forfeiture of unpaid spiffs unless required by law (p.003).

Motus Mileage.details: Mileage reimbursed through Motus at IRS rates; tracking through the platform is mandatory (p.003).

Merchandise Accelerator.details: Quarterly merchandise goal attainment adds +2% to the base commission rate back to dollar one; ≥110% attainment adds another +1% bonus rate (2025 Dental AE Plan.pdf p.004).

Windfall/Large Deals.details: > $1M non-private practice deals may have commission rates reduced (not below 1% GP) and do not count toward goal achievement; sales management evaluates effort case-by-case (p.006).

Equipment Commission Eligibility.details: Equipment commissions (4%) require the order to be entered as a Salesforce opportunity with the AE linked before the equipment order is placed (p.004).

Adjusted GP Deductions.details: Freight waivers incur an $80/order deduction (with DSO/Institutional exceptions); equipment freight, discounts, vendor credits, and sample accounts all reduce adjusted GP before commissions are deemed earned (p.006).

Sales Crediting.details: Adjusted GP dollars count only after invoice posting, GP calculation, and revenue recognition requirements have been satisfied (p.006).

SPIF Governance.details: AEs must be employed on the spiff pay date; cash and non-cash spiffs are taxable and reflected on the pay schedule (p.006).

KPI Weighting.details: Quarterly bonus target splits 40% ACE, 30% Edge, 20% Clinician’s Choice, and 10% Equipment; each component pays based on the published achievement chart (2025_GDG_Clinical Product Sales Specialist Plan.pdf p.001).

Achievement Chart.details: Top-line sales achievement from 70%–130% maps to bonus payouts from 0%–200%; payouts are prorated between listed points (p.002).

Henry Schein Products Kicker.details: Quarterly HS Products goal ≥100% pays an additional $1,000 gross bonus (p.002).

Sales Crediting.details: Participants sign the standard acknowledgement prohibiting side letters and requiring revenue recognition before bonuses are deemed earned (p.006).

Plan Levels & Salary Reviews.details: Three plan levels (A ≥$200K, B $100–$199K, C < $100K) determine base salary and commission rates; two consecutive years of ≥105% achievement trigger salary review for potential increase, while two years ≤80% trigger potential decrease (2025_GDG_Dental Equipment Specialist Plan.pdf p.004).

Windfall/Large Deals.details: Management may adjust commission rates (not below 1% GP) for non-private practice deals >$1M, and such deals do not count toward goal achievement (p.007).

Equipment Annual True-Up.details: If annual GP performance meets or exceeds 100%, 115%, or 130%, any quarter below that level is recalculated using the annual rate, with additional payment in December (p.007).

Adjusted GP Deductions.details: Freight deductions (3% core, 1.5% digital), pre-approved rebates, participant-requested discounts, and returns reduce adjusted GP; credit only after invoice, GP calculation, and revenue recognition (p.008).

HSP Fixed Rate.details: Henry Schein Product sales pay a fixed monthly commission rate regardless of performance tiers; Access FSC quarterly goals weight HSP at 25% of the KPI mix (2025 Dental FSC Compensation Plan updated.pdf p.004, p.022).

Plan Levels & Mileage Options.details: Plan levels (1/2/3 with Motus vs Enhanced mileage options) are set by prior-year merchandise GP and determine commission rates, mileage reimbursement mechanics, and eligibility for the +1% all-quarter kicker (p.004).

Adjusted GP Deductions.details: Freight waivers ($86/order for Plan 3/3M, $76 for Plan 2/2M), equipment freight (3% core/1.5% digital), pre-approved rebates, vendor free goods, participant discounts, and returns reduce adjusted GP; credit only after invoice, GP calc, and revenue recognition (p.009–010).

Large Non-Private Practice Deals.details: Deals >$1M for non-private practice customers can have commission credit reduced (not below 1% GP) and do not count toward goal achievement (p.022).

Expense Reimbursement.details: First $7,692/$9,615 GP paid at 5% plus Enhanced Business Expense Reimbursement; participants taxed on incremental rate and may request additional reimbursement with IRS Pub 463 documentation; management may transfer to Concur plan.

Draws/Guarantees.details: Same recoverable draw and 150-day AR deduction schedule as standard plan.

Dispute Window.details: Participants have 60 days from monthly commission advance to dispute calculations before amounts become final.

Termination/Final Pay.details: Mirror standard plan (7-day LOA credit limit, commissions only on sales invoiced before separation, overdraw repayment).

Windfall/Large Deals.details: No windfall or large-deal clause present; requires governance addendum.

Expense Reimbursement.details: Mileage and auto expenses reimbursed at IRS rate through Motus/Concur; participants must submit Concur reports with IRS Publication 463-compliant documentation; may request additional compensation if expenses exceed reimbursements (p.11-12).

Clawback/Recovery.details: Same recoverable draw and AR deduction rules as standard plan.

Dispute Window.details: 60-day window from commission advance to dispute calculations; after that commissions final.

Windfall/Large Deals.details: No windfall or large-deal clause provided; requires addendum.

Eligibility & Payout.details: Must be employed at payout to receive annual bonus; new hires prorated by start date; payouts in Q1 following year.

KPI Governance.details: Four KPIs (new accounts, high-dollar, custom procedural packs, equipment GP) each pay 25% on all-or-nothing basis; no partial credit described.

Exceptions/Disputes.details: Participants have 30 days after quarter/year completion to dispute bonus calculations; plan can be modified/terminated at any time, including retroactively (p.4).

Windfall/Large Deals.details: No windfall or large-deal clause defined; gap noted.

Shared Lab Rules.details: Shared Clinical Lab sales require Salesforce entry and split commissions (service owner 15%, non-service owner 10%); no other premiums apply.

Clawback/Recovery.details: Same recoverable draw and AR deduction schedule as standard plan.

Sales Crediting.details: Freight waivers, customer handling, sample account controls, and obsolete inventory deductions mirror the Surgical plan.

Windfall/Large Deals.details: No windfall or large-deal clause; requires governance addendum.

Expense Reimbursement.details: Enhanced reimbursement for first $7,692/$9,615 GP; participants taxed on incremental rate and may request additional compensation with IRS Publication 463 documentation; management can transfer to Concur plan.

Clawback/Recovery.details: Recoverable draw and AR deductions mirror standard plan.

Dispute Window.details: 60-day window from commission advance to dispute calculations.

Windfall/Large Deals.details: No windfall/large-deal clause included; gap noted.

Freight Deductions.details: Standard freight waivers allowed for up to 10% of orders; beyond threshold, $8/order (Plan 3/3M) or $7/order (Plan 2/2M) deducted from merchandise GP; equipment freight adjusts GP by 3% (core) or 1.5% (digital).

Draws/Guarantees.details: Bi-weekly recoverable draws typically capped at 60% of prior-year commissions; draw adjustments at company discretion; disputes within 30 days.

Territory Management.details: FSC must physically service accounts; cross-territory assignments require approval and growth proof; remote accounts must show growth to retain.

Expense Reimbursement.details: Enhanced Plan adds +2% commission as mileage reimbursement; CA FSCs may request additional compensation with documentation.

Windfall/Large Deals.details: No windfall/large-deal clause documented; gap noted.

Tier Calculation.details: Inside sales territories classified by 3-month rolling average GP; premiums tied to territory tier.

Clawback/Recovery.details: Recoverable draws and AR deductions follow standard plan schedule.

Windfall/Large Deals.details: No windfall/large-deal clause present; gap noted.

Eligibility.details: ISCs must be employed at payout; bonus prorated for new hires; maximum combined payout (with super achiever) is $11K.

KPI Structure.details: Six KPIs with defined allocations: MELPS GP, HS Brand, Equipment (quarterly); Flu, Rimidi/Stat Kits, New Bill-To (annual). Quarterly payouts can be restored to 100% if annual performance ≥100%; super achiever up to 400% per KPI.

Windfall/Large Deals.details: No windfall/large-deal clause documented; gap noted.
